motivation: There is value on VEX files and it was something we're thinking about even before the PR
comment: At least people using the software will know about the weaknesses of the software/library. All the discussions by the way should consider also the CVEs' quality. In the world of bug bounties/CVE stats/CVE explosion, one important thing should also get back to have a good quality CVEs, because at this stage there's a lot of noise and false positives.

motivation: See my comment on the pull request itself: https://github.com/volution/kawipiko/pull/15#issuecomment-2405579256
comment: See my comment on the pull request itself: https://github.com/volution/kawipiko/pull/15#issuecomment-2405579256

motivation: The listed vulnerabilities were not accepted as valid. All of them relate to a valid protest against the Russian war.
comment: There are services available that show the vulnerabilities for a given SBOM. This approach is better than having them in a static file that needs updating several times.

motivation: I had actually already updated the problematic component but had forgotten to update the SBOM.  So instead of accepting the PR, I updated the SBOM and cut a new release.  Thank you very much for bringing this to my attention.
comment: Security disclosure is of prime importance in modern Open Source Software

motivation: So far, the issues in dependencies are likely not affecting the user/operator. Nevertheless, I update the dependencies immediately. However, keeping track of documentation takes too much time without proper tooling. If it were a single command line, I would support VEX.
comment: As written above, just updating dependencies and SBOM is much easier than managing things. It could be easy with proper tooling.
